p: Antigenic and deleterious non-antigenic mutations occur only during transmission events; the model assumes that viruses within a single individual host are genotypically homogeneous. The model also assumes no co-infection, no seasonal forcing [ 45, 53], and no short-term immunity that would broadly prevent reinfection after recovering from infection. We assume parameter values provided in Koelle & Rasmussen [ 10, 31, 54– 56]. The recovery rate and baseline reproduction number were estimated for influenza A/H3N2, while the evolutionary parameters are based on studies of other RNA viruses including influenza A/H1N1 [ 10, 54– 56].
